title: SoC COMM_ST 395-0-21 Topics in Communication Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course addresses the interactions of family members as they confront and manage members' health issues. We will examine: (1) family theories that apply to such interactions, (2) family communication patterns that emerge around certain health-related issues, and (3) explore new directions in this new area. The concept of "health" will be broadly interpreted, including physical and psychological health. Topics will include cancer (childhood & adult), genetic disorders, addictions, mental illness and confronting death. The effect of family members' views of illness will be considered through the lenses of age, ethnicity and culture, and religion.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Miller-Day, M. (2011). Family Communication: Connections, and Health Transitions. New York, NY: Peter Lang.
